intro: Willoughbya nitidula, commonly known as the slender willoughbya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Willoughbya nitidula is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments.
